events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle and another car on Main Street at 8 AM.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords in the initial report.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and contact the claimant.
The claimant received official acknowledgement from the insurer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle and a police accident report for further processing.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including photos of the car damage and the official police report.
The insurance company began an official investigation into the collision and damage to the insured vehicle.
All facts were verified, including fault determination and damage assessment for the auto accident claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering vehicle repair costs as per policy terms.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the prompt handling of the claim.
The insurer approved the claim officially confirming the compensation amount for the vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account to cover the approved auto damage repair costs.
The auto accident claim was closed after full payment and resolution confirmation with the customer.
